abstract: Greece endorses six-month extension of sanctions against Russia, allaying fears that election victory of left-wing party would undermine Europe's efforts to pressure Russia over its actions toward Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: On Thursday, Greece backed away from strong statements denouncing sanctions, calming worries that the election of a far-left government in Greece could upend Europe’s policy toward Moscow.
snippet: On Thursday, Greece backed away from strong statements denouncing sanctions, calming worries that the election of a far-left government in Greece could upend Europe’s policy toward Moscow.

headline.main: Greece Steps Back Into Line With European Union Policy on Russia Sanctions
headline.print_headline: Greece Steps Back Into Line With European Union Policy on Russia Sanctions
